main event: Multiple witnesses observed an unidentified object in the sky over Fukuoka, Japan on October 15, 1948, estimating it to be about 30 to 40 feet in diameter and metallic in appearance, emitting a bluish-white light.
interesting points: Witnesses reported the object hovered at approximately 1500 feet altitude for 15 to 20 minutes, The object moved rapidly across the sky and disappeared suddenly, All witnesses stated with confidence that the object was not an airplane or helicopter, Psychological evaluations deemed the witnesses reliable, The report includes multiple radar observations and interception attempts by F-51 pilots.
sighted object: an unidentified metallic object emitting bluish-white light
witness description: Pilots and radar observers with military experience
